data.content:
noun
plural orders of magnitude
[count] :a range of numbers or sizes that goes from a particular number or size to 10 times larger or 10 times smaller
These molecules are several orders of magnitude smaller than a grain of sand.
Donations to the organization increased by an order of magnitude [=they became 10 times greater] after the earthquake. - often used figuratively
two problems of the same order of magnitude [=two problems that are equally important]
